title: 15. IRRI Agronomy Challenge: When to Harvest (19 April 2012)

subtasks: Measure moisture content using a moisture meter
Collect representative samples from the field

tasks.task: Irrigation decision for future crop stages
MAINTASK: Assessing crop readiness for harvest
subtasks: Observe the proportion of grains in the panicle that are straw yellow (80% indicator).
Check the hardness of grains in the lower part of the panicle (dough stage).
Use a moisture meter to measure grain moisture content by crushing samples.
Collect multiple representative samples from the field to ensure a representative average.
Determine the optimal harvest timing considering soil moisture levels, expected weather conditions, and potential lodging.

tasks.task: Irrigation decision for future crop stages
subtasks: Evaluate the current soil moisture level (considering it's heavy clay).
Assess the expected weather conditions (forecasted heat and dryness).
Decide whether to irrigate based on the risk to combine operations and the proximity to harvest (voting to withhold irrigation for two weeks).
